inventory.description: You look at the items you have gathered from the room.

room.description: You are in a small 4-walled room. The walls and floor are bare, cut stone.

bookcase.description: A large oak bookcase appears to be fastened to the wall. It is mostly barren.

table.description: A sturdy mahogany table is placed in the corner. A candelabra sits on it, what little wax remains has run down from the stick holders. There is also a flawed glass pyramid that gently refracts the ambient light around it.

onuse.description: You find the painting lifts away from the wall. You place it on the floor. Behind it are 3 keyholes.
You don't know what else to do with the painting.

lockbox.description: The picture of the altar on the box is a precise match for its representation in the painting.

painting.description: An old faded oil painting shows an artistic image of the cathedral above, in its former glory.

onuse.description: You find the plant and the soil lift away together in one clump. You put them to one side.
You don't know what else to do with the bush.

bush.description: A bushy plant sits in the corner. While it appears to be long dead, it is still thick with browned foliage.

door.description: A heavy door is set tightly into the wall. The hinges appear to be on the other side.

onuse.description: With some effort you are able to roll the rug up revealing a cold stone floor beneath. You replace the rug.

rug.description: A heavy, vibrant rug lies on the floor in shades of 4 familiar colours.

onuse.description: Pulling the chest away from the wall reveals a cold stone wall and floor. However, you notice a drawer on the bottom that opens backwards. You pull this out.
You don't know what else to do while the chest is locked.

chest.description: A large chest lies on the floor with thick metallic clasps binding it shut. Each of the 2 clasps has a lock that you can see.

pot.description: A musty teracotta pot remains where the bushy plant once stood.

onuse.description: This is only half a key, with a groove to attach another half. You'll need to combine the two for it to be useful.

brass-key-2.description: The 2 brass parts slot together neatly producing a single brass-key.

brass-key-1.description: This is a dirty piece of brass. It appears to be half of a key, with a groove on the back where another half might attach.

onuse.description: Opening the book you observe that it was written in 1253 by Vlad Ostrock, and appears to be a historical reference. A large number 6 has been written inside the front cover.

red-book.description: A bright tome in a vibrant red leather backing. It is entitled 'Riverdell's Monarchs'.

onuse.description: Opening the book you observe that it was written in 1231 by Arnold Hughes, and appears to be a philosophical essay. A large number 3 has been written inside the front cover.

cyan-book.description: A light tome in a plain cyan cover. It is entitled 'The mystery of death'.

onuse.description: Opening the book you observe that it was written in 1212 by Moira Adelade and appears to contain a variety of high brow cooking recipes.

purple-book.description: An old musty tome in a faded purple cover. It appears to have once had a title, but it's long since worn away.

onuse.description: Opening the book you observe that it was written in 1247 by Ellen DuFrain, and appears to be a travel guide with heavy Nilfgaardian influence. A large number 4 has been written inside the front cover.

violet-book.description: A worn tome with a mostly violet cover. It is entitled 'Guide to the Northern Kingdoms'.

onuse.description: Opening the book you observe a series of mathematical calculations about building structures from stone. A piece of paper with a grid and markings on it rests within the book.
Opening the book you observe a series of mathematical calculations about building structures from stone.

dull-book.description: An old musty tome in a faded buff cover. It is entitled 'The mathematics of masonry'.

onuse.description: Inspecting the grid and the markings... you realise it appears to be a specific arangement of stones in a wall with coordinates identifying a specific stone.

grid-note.description: A piece of paper with a grid and markings on it.

onuse.description: Opening the book you see that the centre of the pages have all be cut away to create a recess. Within it is half of a red key.
There is no readable text inside the heavy book due to the recess.

heavy-book.description: A thick tome containing a great many pages. It appears to have never had a title.

onuse.description: This is only half a key, with a groove to attach another half. You'll need to combine the two for it to be useful.

red-key-1.description: A portion of a key made out of a bright red compound. It looks like a piece is missing.

onuse.description: Taking the picture from the frame, you see a word written in an elegant hand: 'golden'. Noting this, you replace the picture.

picture-frame.description: A wooden frame containing a picture of a faceless, female human. She is adorned by various precious tiaras, rings, earings and necklaces.

candelabra.description: A matte brass candleabra is nailed to the table. Its 5 candlestick holders hold nothing more that a little old wax long since melted.

onuse.description: As you move the pyramid, the gentle rainbow light emitted from its faces shifts against the wall.

pyramid.description: A smaller wooden draw with a handle designed to be used to pull it from the table.

onuse.description: You slide the drawer out from the table. Within it you see a small black, string-bound book, a slender letter opener, and a metallic lockbox.
The drawer opens and closes easily.

drawer-one.description: A smaller wooden draw with a handle designed to be used to pull it from the table.

onuse.description: The drawer won't budge. It appears to be locked.

drawer-two.description: A wide wooden draw with a more elaborate handle and a small keyhole beneath.

onuse.description: Attempting to pull the drawer out, it seems to be firmly stuck. There seems to be a pressure point above the handle inside the drawer that is preventing it from moving.

drawer-three.description: A smaller wooden draw with a chipped handle designed to be used to pull it from the table.

onuse.description: Opening the book you observe a long hand-written inventory list. It contains many item names alongside years.

black-book.description: A small black leather book, held closed by a string loop. It looks clean and fresh, but has no markings on the outside.

onuse.description: You need to use this on another item using combine for it to have any use.

letter-opener.description: A plain, dull blade. It is very slender, yet surprisingly sturdy for its size.

description.locked: The box lid won't budge without the correct combination being entered using solve.
description.unlocked: The unlocked box opens and closes easily.

description.locked: A grey metallic box, it is undecorated save for a picture of the cathedral's altar, but does have a 3-digit combination lock on the front.
description.unlocked: An unlocked grey metallic box, it is undecorated save for a picture of the cathedral's altar and a solved combination lock.

solve.description: With a satisfying click, the lockbox pops open.

onuse.description: This is only half a key, with a ridge to attach another half. You'll need to combine the two for it to be useful.

brass-key-1.description: The 2 brass parts slot together neatly producing a single brass-key.

brass-key-2.description: This is a dirty piece of brass. It appears to be half of a key, with a ridge on the back which might slot into another part.

onuse.description: You will need to combine this item with the correct keyhole for it to be of use.

brass-key.description: This is a dirty, but complete brass key.

keyholes.description: A series of keyholes are set into the wall. From left-to-right, each has a coloured enamel setting.

onuse.description: The handle turns easily, but the door won't budge. It appears to be locked.

handle.description: A round brass knob is attached to the door.

onuse.description: You can only see blackness through the keyhole.

keyhole.description: A simple, but long keyhole sits in the thick wood of the door.

onuse.description: You need to combine a key with the keyhole to use it.

bronze-lock.description: A dull and plain brass lock, that is impressively sturdy.

onuse.description: You need to combine a key with the keyhole to use it.
You don't know what else to do with the drawer.

secret-drawer.description: A simple drawer in the same wood as the chest. Disappointingly it is empty.

onuse.description: You need to combine a key with the keyhole to use it.

violet-keyhole.description: A keyhole surrounded by a violet enamel panel.

onuse.description: You don't know what else to do with the drawer.

cyan-keyhole.description: A keyhole surrounded by a cyan enamel panel.

onuse.description: You don't know what else to do with the drawer.

red-keyhole.description: A keyhole surrounded by a red enamel panel.
